title: Inflation Adjustment Calculator
description: Adjust monetary values for inflation. Calculate the equivalent value of money from one year to another accounting for inflation.

inputs.name: amount
inputs.label: Amount
inputs.helpText: Enter the monetary amount to adjust

inputs.name: startYear
inputs.label: Start Year
inputs.helpText: Enter the year of the original amount

inputs.name: endYear
inputs.label: End Year
inputs.helpText: Enter the target year for adjustment

inputs.name: inflationRate
inputs.label: Annual Inflation Rate
inputs.helpText: Enter the average annual inflation rate (default: 3%)

formula: (function() { const years = Math.abs(endYear - startYear); const totalInflation = Math.pow(1 + inflationRate / 100, years) - 1; const adjusted = amount * (1 + totalInflation); return { adjustedAmount: adjusted, totalInflation: totalInflation * 100 }; })()

variables.startYear: The year of the original amount

howTo: Enter the monetary amount you want to adjust
Enter the start year (when the amount was from)
Enter the end year (target year for adjustment)
Enter the annual inflation rate (default is 3%)
Click "Calculate" to see the inflation-adjusted amount

examples.title: Example 1: $1000 from 2000 to 2024
examples.description: Adjust $1000 from year 2000 to 2024 with 3% annual inflation

faq.question: What is inflation adjustment?
faq.answer: Inflation adjustment converts a monetary value from one time period to another, accounting for the decrease in purchasing power due to inflation. It shows what an amount from the past would be worth in today's dollars.

faq.question: How is inflation calculated?
faq.answer: Inflation is calculated using compound interest formula: Adjusted Amount = Original Amount Ã— (1 + inflation rate)^years. This accounts for inflation compounding over multiple years.

faq.question: What is a typical inflation rate?
faq.answer: In developed countries, a typical annual inflation rate is around 2-3%. However, inflation rates vary by country and economic conditions. You can use historical data or current economic forecasts.

faq.question: Why adjust for inflation?
faq.answer: Inflation adjustment helps compare the real purchasing power of money across different time periods. It's essential for financial planning, historical analysis, and understanding the true value of investments or salaries.
